page.title: 11Whitwell Wood
page.content: The main trees are sycamore,beech and fir.The trees were planted by the Forestry Commission.The area covered is 440 acres.There are other types of plants;orchids,columbine,primrose violet,dog daisy,bracken and other plants.Whitwell Wood was part of Sherwood Forest.The recently discovered workings are evidence of a Roman town which is the first sign of life in Whitwell Wood. Whitwell wood is used for timber,hedge stakes,pulp and a nature reserve.The Welbeck Estate owns the wood.There was a test drill for the pebble 2 coal seam between Whitwell Colliery and High Moor Colliery.There is a well on the east side and a spring on the far north end.The nature group have planted a coppice in the wood to give local children assistance with natural history.
